answers.answer: This is my third and I feel each one has been rougher than the last but still so worth it what about u
This is my second pregnancy and it's way different than my first. My pregnancy isn't harder, being pregnant and having an 8 month old is the hard part.
Having baby number 3 definitely different than 1 and 2.

I'm still not to sure about this pregnancy, bc my youngest is 11 months. I had a good age difference from the oldest to youngest 3 years.  So this time around its so close, I'm carrying around my 25lb baby bc she can't walk and it taking all of my energy. I have support friends and family that say its going to be okay. But I'm still just not sure. Like sometimes I'm happy and other times I cry. Bc idk how to deal.
This is my 4th pregnancy, 3rd baby, and it has been awful! I've been so sick and I have had random bleeding.  The dic says baby is healthy so I guess I will just suck it up. Lol

Im on my 4th pregnancy, babies 1 & 2 were a breeze, baby #3 i has some mild nausea caused by some frozen foods and this kid is killing me!! The constant nausea, the headaches, bloody noses but its worth it =)

I had a difficult pregnancy with my daughter (who's now two). I gained 30 lbs by the time I was 20 weeks. Had preeclampsia,  swelling, sick all the time. This pregnancy is the opposite,  I've only gained 5-6 lbs. And already 17 weeks! I still have nausea but no real morning sickness.  So far much easier than the last (:

This is my 2nd and this pregnancy is completely different than my first.  Other thanmy belly getting bigger and an insane craving for eggs lol I would've never known I was pregnat the first time I had no symptoms. This time around I am having a ton of symptoms most of which are not to my liking.
Having baby 4 and I don't remember any of this "New" stuff from my previous pregnancies

My first was, a head a little bit of nausea in the evening (threw up some nights, but not all). This time around I could keep anything down, was sick all day. I had to take medication.  I am definitely showing sooner, even though I haven't actually gained any weight at 16 weeks. My back already hurts and it didn't at all thru my first.

My 1st pregnancy was a breeze until labor. This one is hell. I get migraines nothing helps, had bad morning sickness and vomiting.  Aches and pains.  Not being able to sleep.  I have acne this pregnancy. My hair grows 3 times as fast.

This is my second pregnancy. My fb is 6. My pregnancy with him was a breeze. Minimal nausea, only tired in the beginning. The end was kinda rough with migraines and heartburn, but still bearable. This one has been awful. Found out at 3 1/2 weeks, morning sickness started at 5 weeks and is still hanging around at 16 weeks. I get headaches often, and I'm still fatigued all the time. my back hurts every other day it seems like, and in my first trimester the constipation was SO bad I would cry going to the bathroom. I'm still taking zofran and dealing with no appetite. But I have gained 10lbs so far, so I'm doing something right.

With my first, (she's 15 months now) I was never sick! I was full of energy the whole 9 months and worked two jobs until the second trimester and just one until I was 39.5 weeks even though I wasn't allowed to go into labor due to placenta previa. I had a tad bit of swelling in my feet at the end of the last trimester and that was about it. This time, (I'm just at 16 weeks) I am still feeling nauseated, but getting a little better. Nothing really ever sounds good enough to eat, I have the absolute worst dry mouth & throat that makes waking up in the morning miserable and I just want to trow up because of it, my eyesight is actually getting really bad, I can barely sleep at night, and feel tired all of the time... So, this time is completely different than the last time!!
I'm on my 3rd and it's by far the hardest one so far yet! everything hurts and I'm exhausted. So many new and different things this time around
This is my 3rd and its slightly different so far like I haven't had morning sickness early on like I did with the other two, also this time iv had horrible headaches but I didn't last 2 time xx

This is my second pregnancy and its been a breeze. I just found out I am having another little boy, I had been convinced this time I was having a girl because the pregnancy had been so different to my son. I have had no sickness, very little of any kind of symptoms (other than tiredness). I struggled through my first pregnancy with constant sickness and struggling to eat anything. This has been a walk in the park :)

question: So how are you other not first time mums finding this pregnancy compared to your last or previous pregnancies
title: Not ftm's
